title: BDO administrators ‘abused powers to foreclose on loan’
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now BDO administrators ‘abused powers to foreclose on loan’ Zurich says Dunbar denies all the allegations Scott Barbour/Getty Images Zurich says Dunbar denies all the allegations Scott Barbour/Getty Images James Hurley   19 2015 
Administrators from BDO, the accountancy and restructuring firm, have been accused of abusing their legal powers to help a bank to foreclose on borrowers “aggressively”. 
Julie Davey, a property developer, is suing James Money, a restructuring partner at BDO, and Jim Stewart-Koster, a former BDO partner, after the demise of her business, Angel House, in December 2012. 
The joint administrators were accused in a High Court hearing last week of wrongfully engaging in a “light-touch administration” to help Zurich, the Swiss insurance giant, to wind down the loan book of Dunbar Bank, one of its British subsidiaries. 
Stephen Davies, QC,
